text:
I have just installed 2.0.53 and made the necessary adjustments for the
relocation of the apache2.conf file. But Apache just dies now and throws up the
following error in the log:

child pid 17168 exit signal Segmentation fault (11)

I have rolled back to 2.0.52 and 2.0.51 but to no avail. I have physcially
looked at the memory and components within the server case. But Apache is
completely dead! It will start up ok, but as soon as any client makes a request
of it, it will fail with the above error.

I CANNOT TELL YOU HOW DESPERATE I AM AT THIS STAGE. I have searched all the
Forums with Gentoo amongst others. Have Googled this thing to death. The server
has been out of action for 24 hrs now and I simply am at my wits end.
creator: jmf@cybertrex.co.uk

text:
See if you can get it to write a coredump at the time of the crash.

Set CoreDumpDirectory directive to a directory where child process has write access.

Run "ulimit -c unlimited" prior to apachectl start.

Hopefully, the error log message will then indicate that a coredump was written.

gdb /path/to/httpd /path/to/core
(gdb) bt full
(gdb) quit

Paste in output of gdb.
creator: trawick@apache.org

re-emerge apr and apr-util. This should stop the crashing.
